au.com.codeka.carrot.tmpl.parse

Class Tokenizer

  • java.lang.Object
    • au.com.codeka.carrot.tmpl.parse.Tokenizer

  • public class Tokenizer
extends java.lang.Object
    The Tokenizer takes an input stream of character and turns it into a stream of Tokens.

    Each Token represents a high-level component of the template. For example, the following template:

    Text {{ hello }} stuff {% if (blah) %} more stuff {% end %}

    Corresponds to the following stream of tokens: 

    TokenType=FIXED, Content="Text "
TokenType=ECHO, Content=" hello "
TokenType=FIXED, Content=" stuff "
TokenType=TAG, Content=" if (blah) "
TokenType=FIXED, Content=" more stuff "
TokenType=TAG, Content=" end "

      Construct a new Tokenizer with the given LineReader, and a default TokenFactory.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Tokenizer

        public Tokenizer(LineReader ins)
        Construct a new Tokenizer with the given LineReader, and a default TokenFactory.
        Parameters:
        ins - A LineReader to read tokens from.

      • Tokenizer

        public Tokenizer(LineReader ins,
                 @Nullable
                 TokenFactory tokenFactory)
        Construct a new Tokenizer with the given LineReader and TokenFactory.
        Parameters:
        ins - A LineReader to read tokens from.
        tokenFactory - A TokenFactory for creating the tokens. If null, a default token factory that just creates instances of Token is used.

    • Method Detail

      • getNextToken

        @Nullable
public Token getNextToken()
                             throws CarrotException
        Gets the next token from the stream, or null if there's no tokens left.
        Returns:
        The next Token in the stream, or null if we're at the end of the stream.
        Throws:
        CarrotException - when there's an error parsing the tokens.

      • getPointer

        public ResourcePointer getPointer()
        Returns:
        The current ResourcePointer, useful for outputting where in the file an error occurred.
